required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Improving Time-Based Prospective Memory in TBI
clinical_study.official_title: Improving Time-Based Prospective Memory in TBI: A Feasibility and Dosing Study

brief_summary.textblock: This research aims to test aspects of a computer-based cognitive rehabilitation program designed to improve thinking skills in individuals with traumatic brain injury (TBI).

detailed_description.textblock: This research aims to test aspects of a computer-based cognitive rehabilitation program designed to improve thinking skills in individuals with traumatic brain injury (TBI), particularly improving the ability to remember to do things in the future.

study_design_info.masking_description: Study staff conducting baseline and follow-up assessments will be blind as to which group participants are placed. Study staff conducting intervention sessions will be blind to participants' baseline and follow-up assessment performance.

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline through final follow-up assessment (16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: visual analog scale to assess participants' tolerability of intervention

primary_outcome.time_frame: phone screen to in-person screen (within 2 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: percentage of interested participants who met eligibility criteria via phone screen are eligible at in person screen

primary_outcome.time_frame: baseline to mid-intervention assessment #2 (8 weeks), mid-intervention assessment #3 (12 weeks), and final follow-up (16 weeks)
primary_outcome.description: adherence rate to treatment sessions within 8 weeks (i.e., attendance at 16 sessions), 12 weeks (24 sessions), and 16 weeks (32 sessions)

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in time monitoring & time-based prospective memory
secondary_outcome.description: Via a task that simultaneously assesses time monitoring frequency as it relates to time-based prospective memory performance.

secondary_outcome.measure: Changes in strategic cognitive functions (performance on NIH EXAMINER)
secondary_outcome.description: Via the NIH EXAMINER, a comprehensive computerized battery of tests designed to assess strategic cognitive functioning, particularly related to executive functions and related domains.

arm_group.description: The experimental group will receive treatment program designed to train strategic cognitive functions. Sessions will last 50 minutes and take place twice per week for 16 weeks.
The control group will receive no active treatment and will be treated as a "no-contact control" group.

intervention.description: Program designed to improve strategic cognitive domains (e.g., complex attention, working memory)

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Sustained a moderate-to-severe TBI at least one year prior to assessment
- Fluent in English
- Demonstrate impairment in strategic cognitive abilities
Exclusion Criteria:
- Significant neurological history other than TBI
- Significant psychiatric history (e.g., bipolar disorder, schizophrenia)
- Significant substance abuse history
- Steroid and/or benzodiazepine use
